intro: Jaltomata auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate jaltomata, is a species of flowering plant in the family Solanaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests. Jaltomata auriculata is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
